channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - HP Hero
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2022 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Any investigation of a former president raises a host of highly sensitive and potentially explosive political and legal questions
item.description: The move by the Justice Department to bring two top aides to former Vice President Mike Pence in front of a federal grand jury is the most aggressive public step taken yet by prosecutors investigating the plots to subvert the 2020 election.

item.title: DOJ has reached out to more former White House officials, ex-Trump official says
item.description: The Department of Justice has reached out to other Trump White House officials regarding the January 6 attack on the US Capitol in addition to two top aides to former Vice President Mike Pence, a former administration official told CNN on Wednesday.

item.title: Trump's defense secretary denies there were orders to have 10K troops ready to deploy on January 6
item.description: Former acting Defense Secretary Chris Miller told the House select committee investigating the Capitol Hill insurrection that former President Donald Trump never gave him a formal order to have 10,000 troops ready to be deployed to the Capitol on January 6, 2021, according to new video of Miller's deposition released by the committee.

item.title: NYT reporter: ' Tragic' emails reveal fake electoral plan
item.description: The New York Times reporter Maggie Haberman breaks down her findings that reveals dozens of pages by Trump advisers detailing Trump team's 'fake' electoral scheme.

item.title: Analysis: Trump shows his 2024 campaign would take the country down a dark and dangerous road
item.description: The last time Donald Trump delivered a major speech in Washington, DC, from outside the White House it unleashed a vicious mob attack. There was no violence this time, but his searing bombast may have heralded the dawn of a new era of American extremism.

item.title: Opinion: Marjorie Taylor Greene's words on Christian nationalism are a wake-up call
item.description: Republican Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene explicitly labeled herself a Christian nationalist on Saturday. This shocking statement by a sitting member of Congress should serve as a wake-up call to everyone, and particularly, I believe, to Christians.

item.title: 'Shameless': Anderson Cooper on new Trump remarks
item.description: Former DC Metropolitan police officer Michael Fanone, who was attacked by rioters on January 6, and Anderson Cooper discuss the difference between former President Donald Trump's comments about law enforcement and how he acted on January 6.

item.title: Biden 'feeling great' and back to work in person after testing negative for Covid-19 and leaving isolation
item.description: • A stir crazy Joe Biden fought Covid cabin fever with help from his dog and a stack of books about Ireland • Covid cases rise across the country again, as many children prepare to return to school • Scientist at forefront of China's early investigations into Covid-19 steps down

item.title: Stocks rise with Fed expected to raise rates today
item.description: • Analysis: The pandemic's economic winners are seeing their fortunes reversed • Opinion: The toughest part of the Fed's job may already be done • What the Fed rate hike means for you

item.title: Video: High inflation leaves little room for unexpected costs
item.description: CNN's Natasha Chen reports from California on what some Americans struggling with high inflation are doing to make ends meet.

item.title: Brittney Griner testifies she was made to sign documents without understanding what they said
item.description: US basketball star Brittney Griner is testifying in a Russian courtroom Wednesday as part of her ongoing trial on drug charges, for which she faces up to 10 years in prison.

item.title: Ukraine confirms strikes on key bridge in Kherson
item.description: • 'Biggest fear' has come true as Russia cuts gas to Europe • Brittney Griner will testify in Russian court as trial continues • Opinion: The American-made weapons that could change everything

item.title: Russian threats to close Jewish Agency strike a nerve in Israel
item.description: Israeli officials are trying to tamp down the diplomatic fracas that has erupted in recent weeks as Moscow has sought to dissolve the Jewish Agency's Russian branch, an organization that helps Jews emigrate to Israel.

item.title: Sen. Josh Hawley defends Jan. 6 actions, including fist pump
item.description: In an interview with CNN's Manu Raju, Sen. Josh Hawley (R-MO) defends his actions on the day of the January 6 insurrection.

item.title: After surviving abuse from their parents for years, 6 Turpin children were placed in a foster home 'of horrors,' attorney says
item.description: Six of the 13 Turpin children -- who were tortured for years by their biological parents -- were then placed in a foster home where they endured a "second bout" of abuse, including sexual, physical and emotional abuse, and their reports were ignored by the foster care agency, an attorney for two of the children told HLN.

item.title: 'A death sentence': American teacher sentenced to 14 years in a penal colony
item.description: The family of an American sentenced to 14 years at a hard labor camp in Russia fears that he has been given what amounts to a "a death sentence" and is calling on the Biden administration to designate him as wrongfully detained, which would trigger formal diplomatic efforts to secure his release.

item.title: Hungarian leader Viktor Orban's 'mixed race' speech condemned by ex-aide and Holocaust victims' group
item.description: Hungary's hardline nationalist leader Viktor Orban is facing international condemnation after making remarks on race and multiculturalism that were slammed as a "pure Nazi text" by his longtime aide.

item.title: Unruly passenger forces flight from London to Los Angeles to divert to Salt Lake City
item.description: A disruptive passenger onboard a Virgin Atlantic flight from London's Heathrow airport to Los Angeles on Tuesday caused the aircraft to be diverted to Salt Lake City, according to an airline statement.

item.title: Candace Cameron Bure explains JoJo Siwa calling her 'rudest celebrity'
item.description: According to Candace Cameron Bure, everything is "all good" between the actress and JoJo Siwa after Siwa pegged her as the "rudest celebrity" she's ever met.

item.title: CEOs buy 50,000 Mega Millions tickets for employees
item.description: Raising Cane's Co-CEO AJ Kumaran tells CNN New Day that the company spent $100,000 on 50,000 Mega Million lottery tickets for its employees. Nobody won the jackpot so Kumaran says they are doing it all over again.

item.title: 3 climbers reported dead this week at Montana's Glacier National Park
item.description: Three people were reported dead this week while climbing mountains in Glacier National Park in Montana, park officials said Tuesday.

item.title: Soccer player dies after fight over referee decision
item.description: A 29-year-old California soccer player died 15-days after a large fight erupted during a match over a disagreement with the referee's decision, according to the Oxnard Police Department.

item.title: Tony Dow's management team removes statement star has died
item.description: After sharing a statement on his verified Facebook account Tuesday morning that Tony Dow, an actor and director best known for his role as older brother Wally Cleaver on "Leave It to Beaver," had died, Dow's management team has removed the statement.

item.title: 'America's Got Talent' judges stunned by school shooting survivor's audition
item.description: Ava Swiss, a student who survived the shooting at Oxford High School in Michigan, stunned "America's Got Talent" judges with a song that helped her cope.

item.title: What it's like inside Boeing's new 777X
item.description: Described as "the world's largest and most efficient twin-engine jet," the Boeing 777X was originally scheduled to enter into service in 2020, but the launch of the jetliner has been beset by delays.

item.title: Talking dog parenting with Chris Evans
item.description: The Internet is obsessed with him. His playful smile. His big, soulful eyes. The fact that he has no bad angle in photos.

item.title: Mega Millions jackpot surges to $1.02 billion
item.description: The Mega Millions jackpot has skyrocketed to $1.02 billion after no ticket matched all six winning numbers in Tuesday night's drawing, the lottery said.

item.title: Animatronic Baby Yoda puppet looks like it's alive
item.description: EFX Collectibles showed off an animatronic Baby Yoda puppet at San Diego Comic-Con. The toy, produced by Garner Holt Productions, is arguably the most lifelike one to date.

item.title: Indiana AG is investigating the doctor who provided abortion services for a 10-year-old Ohio rape victim, doctor's lawyer says
item.description: • CNN Poll: Majority of GOP voters don't want Trump to be their nominee in 2024 • Fearing a wipeout, Democrats try to unify around a simple midterm message: Republicans are 'extremists'

item.title: 'Abortion issue' is one that 'needs to be talked about,' says Michigan head coach Jim Harbaugh
item.description: Michigan Wolverines head coach Jim Harbaugh has told ESPN that "the abortion issue is one that's so big that it needs to be talked about" after saying he'd raise an unwanted baby from a player or staff member of his.

item.title: Opinion: Why no state can ignore Florida's sex ed problem
item.description: The state of Florida is at war with knowledge and information.

item.title: Democratic candidate Alex Lasry to end bid for US Senate in Wisconsin
item.description: Milwaukee Bucks executive Alex Lasry plans to end his US Senate bid on Wednesday, sources tell CNN, just two weeks before Wisconsin's Democratic primary and after spending more than $12 million on his campaign.

item.title: House Democrats will not vote on gun and policing bills this week
item.description: House Democrats will not vote on a series of gun and policing bills this week that would have included an assault weapons ban, according to a source familiar with the matter. This comes after the chamber had scheduled these bills in the wake of a wave of mass shootings across the United States.

item.title: CNN Poll: Majority of GOP voters don't want Trump to be their nominee in 2024
item.description: • States veer right with help from Supreme Court, while Trump loses some support

item.title: Podcast: Don't fall for these money scams
They say it's the best job in the world, but you'll have to stay up all night doing it
item.description: If you're one of the millions of Americans heading to a sleep lab, you probably wonder what's going on while you're dozing off. We tried to stay up all night with Mount Sinai Hospital's sleep techs and found out these medical workers love what they do.

item.title: Shifting your relationship from 'me' to 'we'
item.description: It isn't every day that Bruce Springsteen opens up about his experiences in couples therapy, in this case in the foreword of a book by renowned marriage and family therapist Terrence Real.

item.title: Sex took a pandemic hit, and what to do about it
item.description: When Covid-19 first hit, I stopped getting as many inquiries from new patients for sex therapy.

item.title: The newest superfood is good for you and the planet
item.description: When most of us read the words "plant-based diet," we tend to think of foods such as kale salads and grain bowls or trendy meat replacements. But there is one nonmeat option that's gaining traction as the newest superfood: seaweed.

item.title: This 13-year-old is headed to medical school
item.description: A 13-year-old girl has been accepted to a medical school program only a year after graduating high school.

item.title: Swimwear has undergone a radical redesign
item.description: When bombshell "Baywatch"-era one-pieces and teeny bikinis reigned in the 1990s, relief for many women came in the form of the tankini -- a tank-top silhouette that offered more coverage than most two-pieces, but could still be modest, sporty or sexy. It was one of the few innovations at a time when women's swim styles only catered to few body types and style preferences -- and even got the stamp of approval on Sports Illustrated's 1990 Swimsuit Issue cover.

item.title: Brendan Fraser transforms into a 600 pound man in 'The Whale'
item.description: Brendan Fraser's latest role involves a major transformation.

item.title: Pilot photographs mysterious red glows over Pacific
item.description: Mysterious red glows over the Pacific Ocean have internet sleuths fishing for answers. CNN's Jeanne Moos has this glowing report.

item.title: How to take advantage of rising interest rates
item.description: In anticipation of the Federal Reserve hiking interest rates yet again on Wednesday, consumers will face the question of where to park their savings for the best return and how to minimize their borrowing costs.

item.title: Instagram has a Kardashian problem
item.description: Tati Bruening was once the textbook example of an Instagram user. Since the pandemic, she has been building her career as a photographer on the platform and attracted hundreds of thousands of followers in the process. But recently, her relationship with Instagram started to change.

item.title: Delta wants to eliminate current crowded airport screens
item.description: Delta wants to eliminate current airport screens cluttered with information from dozens of flights. Instead, the company is testing technology at Detroit Metropolitan Wayne County Airport that allows up to 100 travelers to privately see their personal flight information on the same screen.

item.title: Are these building blocks a solution to the plastic problem?
item.description: Startup ByFusion's machine uses steam and compression to create standard building blocks from virtually all types of plastic waste. The company hopes its machines will provide solutions to both infrastructure and the environmental effects of non-recyclable plastics.

item.title: Sandy Hook parents ask jury to return $150 million verdict in defamation suit against Alex Jones
item.description: The lawyer for two Sandy Hook families that have sued right-wing conspiracy theorist Alex Jones asked a jury on Tuesday to award his clients $150 million in damages in a trial that will determine how much money they receive.

item.title: The best Amazon leggings, according to fitness experts
These 25 items from Nordstrom's Anniversary Sale are worth the splurge
Instant Pot Pressure Cookers and Air Fryers are half off at Amazon right now
The 14 best cooling sheets for sweat-free nights, according to experts
On board with Rachel Bilson: The 11 products she can't travel without
The 15 best self-tanners, according to experts
Lululemon's new Chargefeel sneaker just dropped — and we put it to the test
Going on a bike trip? Here are the 15 bike accessories you need, according to experts
Are Stasher bags worth it? Absolutely. Here's why
We tested sports bras for months. These 4 stood out
Yeti products are expensive, here are 19 we think are worth the money
Delicious snacks to consider taking along on your next flight or road trip
The problem with Pence for President
item.description: Former Vice President Mike Pence came to Washington, DC this week with a message: the Republican Party must look forward, not backward, if it intends to win back the White House in 2024.

item.title: Goodbye to a generation of movie tough guys
item.description: These have been hard times for bad guys. Not "bad" bad guys. There are still plenty of those around in real life. I mean the "good" bad guys: movie actors who were so gifted at being hard, tough and occasionally junkyard-dog mean that they're not always as easy to hate. It may say something about the brutality of Summer 2022 that it has taken away so many gifted actors known for brute-force roles.

item.title: Pence's aides testifying before grand jury is huge
item.description: For those who have been waiting for a sign that the Department of Justice is criminally investigating former President Donald Trump's role in the effort to overturn the 2020 election, wait no longer. Reporting from major news outlets that a federal grand jury in Washington, DC has taken testimony from Marc Short and Greg Jacob, former Vice President Mike Pence's chief of staff and legal counsel, respectively, strongly suggests that the investigation has turned decisively towards Trump and his closest associates.

item.title: The state where GOP shows election wasn't stolen
item.description: Want to know if our elections are rife with fraud, and whether we should be concerned about election integrity?

item.title: As a Jewish American, I don't see US the same way after Jan. 6
item.description: Each session of the House committee investigating the events of January 6 showed us just how far parts of the country have traveled, unbeknownst to most of us, down a road towards extremism, white nationalism and antisemitism.

item.title: New York Post's editorial should worry Trump
item.description: After everything Donald Trump has done -- from his seemingly open embrace of bigotry to his failed handling of Covid-19 (which polls show most Americans were critical of) to his efforts to thwart democracy -- it's hard to believe that anything could siphon off the support of the former President's die-hard acolytes.

item.title: Grief can feel like an endless loop of pain. Here's how to coexist with loss
Uvalde, Texas families are finally getting answers - we examine the Texas House report findings on the mass shooting
David Chalian on why the US shouldn't count Democrats out yet in the 2022 midterms - or Trump in 2024
